Title: the raiders minimization

Sheldon: So what’d you think?
That’s it? Good”
My apologies. I chose my words poorly. I should have said you were about to have your world rocked on my couch. Anyway, thank you for watching it. It’s one of my all-time favourites.

Story problem? You, oh, Amy, what a dewy-eyed moon-calf you are. Raiders of the Lost Ark is the love child of Steven Spielberg and George Lucas, two of the most gifted filmmakers of our generation. I’ve watched it 36 times, except for the snake scene and the face-melting scene, which I can only watch when it’s still light out, but, I defy you to find a story problem. Here’s my jaw, drop it.
Oh, I see your confusion. You don’t understand. Indiana Jones was the one in the hat with the whip.
I’ll tell you why. Amy ruined Raiders of the Lost Ark for me, so now I’m trying to find something beloved to her and ruin that.
Yeah, except for the fact that Indiana Jones is completely irrelevant to the story. With or without him, the Nazis find the ark, open it and die.
Oh, it turns out Amy’s beloved Pride and Prejudice is a flawless masterpiece. He’s got too much pride, she’s got too much prejudice, it just works.
Amy has a fondness for the comic strip Marmaduke.
And I think I’ve got it. Consider, a family possesses a dog that is so large and poorly disciplined, he causes nothing but problems. Why do they keep him?
Of course. You know, why couldn’t she just like Ziggy? Yeah? That thing’s riddled with plot holes.
Ooh, I think she’s a fan of Garfield as well. Oh, darn it, now so am I.
Wait, hang on. You’ve spent time with Amy. Can you think of anything she’s fond of that has a bunch of flaws she hasn’t noticed?
Yes. Why?
April 13, a dark night, indeed.
I’m calling to invite you to a spontaneous date night tomorrow evening.

Yes. You were kind enough to watch Raiders of the Lost Ark with me. So I’d like to return the favour by inviting you to watch an episode of your favourite childhood television series, Little House on the Prairie.
Um, I’m putting on lotion. Are you in or not?
Excellent. Then I shall see you tomorrow. Good night, Dr. Fowler.
Good night, indeed. What a rube. Why would I put on lotion when I have such soft hands?

Well, you sit back, relax and enjoy a beloved childhood memory. You see that cabin there? I read they were illegally squatting on Indian land. Yeah. Personally, I think what we did to the Native Americans was wrong, but this is your favourite show, not mine. Oh, look at little Laura Ingalls, eating that peanut butter sandwich. Peanut butter? Huh? That’s strange, since peanut butter wasn’t introduced until the early 1900s. If I knew this show was about time travel, I would have watched it much sooner.
That’s silly. Almost as silly as Dr. Baker having a telephone, since telephones only existed in large cities at that time. This is more like Little House on the Preposterous.
Are you sure? Every time my dad stayed out all night, my mom would put hamster poop in his chewing tobacco.
Fine. I’m mad at you. Not only did you ruin Raiders for me, you may have ruined the whole franchise. Except for the fourth one, which was bad before you got your mitts on it.
Thank you.
Yes. But not as good as I’m going to when I tell you that your precious Garfield has no reason to hate Mondays. He’s a cat. He doesn’t have a job.
That’s true. He collected and delivered the ark to the proper authorities for filing.
Amy: I enjoyed it. When you told me I was going to be losing my virginity, I didn’t think you meant showing me Raiders of the Lost Ark for the first time.
It was very entertaining despite the glaring story problem.
All right. Indiana Jones plays no role in the outcome of the story. If he weren’t in the film, it would turn out exactly the same.
No, I do, and if he weren’t in the movie, the Nazis would have still found the ark, taken it to the island, opened it up and all died, just like they did. Let me close that for ya.
Well, the last time you made an unscheduled video-chat, there was a curly fry in your regular fries and you thought someone might be trying to slip you a mickey.
So what can I do for you?
That sounds lovely. Why are you rubbing your hands together?
I love Little House. It made me want to live on a farm so much I tried to milk my cat. That tangy bowl of Cheerios was not worth the stitches.
You’re trying to get back at me for what I said about Raiders of the Lost Ark.
Sheldon, we’re in a relationship. When you get angry, just tell me. You don’t need to seek revenge.
Well, that’s not how we’re going to do it.
I shouldn’t have said it. I’m sorry.
Leonard: Hey.
Yeah, but Sheldon and Amy were having date night and they don’t need me there to make it awkward. They have each other for that. So, how was school?
You bought my mom’s book?
Oh, come on. Not that book. It, it’s got, like, every horrible story from my childhood in it.
Seriously, please find another book.

There, there’s chapters about potty training, and bed-wetting and masturbation. Basically, if something came out of me, she wrote about it. You know what? Do whatever you want, just don’t talk to me about it.
It was not a crisis. Apparently, I favoured the left one, she got a little lopsided.
Why are you reading Pride and Prejudice?
Actually, they were only digging in the wrong place because Indy had the medallion. Without him, they would have had the medallion and dug in the right place.
No.
They weren’t boobies, they were muscles. And the make-up was green. I was pretending to be The Hulk.
That was to keep my muscles from sagging. Can we please stop talking about this?
Okay, fine. Do you want to know why I dressed like The Hulk? Because I was always mad at my mom and I wanted to smash my way out of that house.

Gee, I don’t know. Maybe it’s because I was always the subject of her little experiments. Did you get to the chapter where she staged the Easter egg hunt with no eggs to see how long I’d keep looking? The answer, by the way, June.
I do, too, but there’s not.
Of course, who am I to argue with a check-plus student? Just warning you, I’m gonna go right. Don’t make a big deal out of it.
Whatcha doin’?
So you’re looking to ruin something for her in the funny pages?
Mm-hmm. And?
Maybe they fell in love with him as a puppy and didn’t know how big he was gonna be.
Sorry, buddy.
I’ll see you later. I gotta go watch a stupid football game with Penny.
I gotta go.
You ready to go?
Some sports bar. It’s like they never even heard of Quidditch. Do we really have to go?
Well, you’re, you’re right. Let’s just go.
Nothing, I’m fine.
No. Not everything is about my mom.
Except this is totally about my mom.
That sounds nice. Yeah.
Or, you know, we could get take-out and watch the Blu-ray extended version of The Hobbit movie with commentary track. On account of how sad I am about my mom.
One sec. Hey. Sorry.
I’ll try, but I might be sad again tonight.
Leave it alone. That’s my girlfriend.
Who just had sex with me at work.
Well, whenever I talk about how awful my mom was, Penny will do anything to make me feel better.
Look, I mean, I’m not proud of it, but it does work. I got her to watch a six-part documentary on Monty Python. Even I was bored, I just wanted to see if she’d make it to the end.
I am, I’m really proud.
Hey, I was just… what is happening?
Oh, oh, I have. So bad.
Uh-huh, I can already feel it working.
Mom?
I… uh…
Oh, please, Mommy. No, Mommy.
I didn’t dream that?
Penny, come back. I’m sad for real now.
Although, technically, Indy was supposed to take the ark to a museum to be studied. He couldn’t even get that done.
Penny: Hi. I thought you went to the comic book store on Wednesdays.
Oh, good. Check it out, The Disappointing Child by Beverly Hofstadter.
Yeah. It’s on the recommended reading list for my psychology class.
Oh, cool. Are there pictures?
Oh, come on. Why? How bad could it be?
Not even the chapter on the breast-feeding crisis?
Oh, my God, you still go left.
Okay, I know you don’t want to talk about it, but can I just ask you one question about your mom’s book?
I just want to know why a five-year-old boy puts on his mom’s make-up and wears balloon boobies.
You were wearing her bra.
Okay, okay. But you know, as a student of psychology who got a check-plus on her first homework assignment, I think, sometimes, it’s good to open up about these things.
Well, why were you so angry?
Sweetie, I’m so sorry. I wish there was something I could do to make you feel better.
Really? Are you sure about that?
Yep. Hey, and maybe this time you don’t try and talk sports with the guys.
Oh, come on. Every time we’re about to hang out with my friends, you don’t want to. It’s like, It’s too loud, or the bathroom’s too dirty, or they put a chicken wing in my ear. I mean…
Hey, what’s going on with you?
All right, hang on. is this still about your mom’s book?
‘Cause if you’re still upset about that, we don’t have to go.
I’m so sorry. I never should have read that book. You know what? You want to just get dinner and watch the game here?
Okay.
Hi. All right, sweetie. You hang in there today.
Okay.
Oh, just a little treat. I know you’ve been feeling really bad about your mom lately.
And I wanted to make you feel better, so I planned something very special for you.
Bernadette told me everything. Now you don’t get the left or the right.
Raj: Which celebrity would you say I look like the most?
Stuart and I are putting dating profiles online, and it’s one of the questions. And thank you, I’d kill for that woman’s bone structure.
Wait, how can, how can anyone ruin Raiders? It’s perfect.

Well, when someone looks at your dating profile, the first thing they see is your picture. I just want to make sure you look fun and full of life and not like a body they just pulled out of the river. All right, here we go, and smile. Okay, uh-uh, that one’s in the bank. How about this? Turn away, and then turn back into it. But when you do, imagine the camera is the girl you want to meet.
Okay, uh, let’s try it again. Uh, but this time, pretend the girl you want to meet doesn’t want to hurt you.
Come on. One more time. Yeah, it’s, it’s a little blurry, but I think that works in your favour. Do you want a beer?
Almost. Oh, what did you put as the one-word description of yourself?
My parents’ money. Uh, what did you put for your best feature?
Come on, dude, you’re being too hard on yourself. You’ve got a lot of good stuff going on.
Well, okay, you’re a, you’re a talented artist, you own your own business.
Okay, well, can we imply that you’re well-endowed?
Okay, now you’re talking like a winner!
Three, two, one.
Attention all shoppers, my business is open for business!
Oh, cool, it tells you when someone’s reading your profile. Jenny309. I hope that’s not her weight.

Yes.
Dude, this is, this is brutal.

Hello.

Like a hero.

I know. It was dumb, I shouldn’t have done it. And it’s making me feel sad. So sad. You know, why don’t you take a bath? I’ll do the dishes.
Wait, wait, if it wasn’t for Indiana Jones, the ark would never have ended up at the warehouse.

Sure. Hey, have you finished writing your profile yet?

Well, they’re not running away screaming, so, no.
I don’t think I’ve ever felt so rejected. And I had a rescue dog who ran back to the pound.
And make them look us in the eye.
